basics.name: Nathaniel Morgan
basics.label: Computer Science and Engineering Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at MIT with expertise in computer science, DevOps, and NLP AI engineering. Focused on LLM research and innovative tech solutions.

work.name: Subconscious.AI
work.summary: Benchmarked SGThread system and worked to deploy novel inference engine and RL trained model to serverless platform[cite: 4].
highlights: Containerized and modified fork of SGLang, facilitating rapid deployment of TIM reasoning model[cite: 4].
Created python interface for Google DataCommons benchmarking of modified inference engine and TIM model through the creation of constrained decoding specifications and a new DC LLM tool[cite: 4].

work.name: BitEnergyAI
work.summary: Developed code for FP8 E4M3 multiplication on FPGA in C++ with Vitis-AI HLS to integrate transformer architecture with efficient floating point arithmetic operations[cite: 4].
highlights: Designed host interface for multiplication between NxD weight matrix and DxM input matrix[cite: 5].
Implemented FP8 multiplication and addition through fused multiply add in C++[cite: 5].
Optimized matrix multiplication kernel through Vitis High-Level Synthesis best design practices[cite: 5].
Conducted software and hardware emulation of FPGA design[cite: 5].

work.name: SALIERI.AI
work.summary: Developed a server-less SaaS deployment with an autoscaling Kubernetes cluster hosted on GCP to facilitate structuring LLM output into parsable JSON based on business text document stores[cite: 6].
highlights: Utilized Node.js to create a web-hook API, enabling communication with a Python "child process" via inter-process communication (IPC)[cite: 6].
Developed 3 containerized micro-services for scalability and created network for intra-container communication[cite: 7].
Restricted LLM output using Context-Free Grammars in GBNF format and JSON to ensure valid generation (token generation constraint)[cite: 7].

Built and optimized an autoscaling Kubernetes cluster with MySQL data store on Google Cloud Platform, with containers stored in Google Artifact Registry and configured using Helm Chart for long-term sustainability[cite: 7].

volunteer.summary: Organized first cohort and facilitated weekly meetings to grow the project to a peak of 30 members[cite: 16].
highlights: Assisted in the creation of 5 in person wellness events and 10 digital wellness campaigns[cite: 16].
Built components of brand including website, Instagram, and initial digital wellness campaigns for public awareness of organization[cite: 16].

awards.title: MIT Student Information and Processing Board (SIPB) (Keyholder) [cite: 15]
Harvard x MIT CO-OP (Student Board Member) [cite: 15]

publications.name: THREAD, "Thinking Deeper with Recursive Spawning"
publications.summary: Phillip Schroeder, Nathaniel W. Morgan, Hongyin Luo, James R. Glass. [cite_start]THREAD, "Thinking Deeper with Recursive Spawning" [NAACL 2025] (arXiv preprint arXiv:2405.17402 2024) [cite: 13]

research.name: Dynamic Data Storage and Retrieval [LOGIC]
research.summary: Leading research within the CSAIL Spoken Language Systems Group (SLS) at MIT, focusing on enhancing retriever performance in resource-augmented generation (RAG) systems through model editing[cite: 8].
highlights: Benchmarked BERT-Large-Cased performance by generating a synthetic query-document set and extracting [CLS] token embeddings from a pretrained model using PyTorch[cite: 9].
Created vector database with FAISS Index and SQLite for efficient document storage and retrieval based on document embeddings[cite: 9].
Adapted MALMEN (ICLR 2025) to fit multi-class classification objective[cite: 9].

research.name: Dynamic Data Storage and Retrieval [DDSR]
research.summary: Lead research within the CSAIL Spoken Language Systems Group (SLS) at MIT into the utilization of Modern Continuous Hopfield Networks to model Memory for LLMs[cite: 9].
highlights: Constructed tensor-based data processing pipeline utilizing Kaggle sentence dataset and tokenization via. [cite_start]Mistral tokenizer[cite: 9, 10].
Trained network with PyTorch and evaluated results with matplotlib[cite: 10].

research.name: Thinking Deeper with Recursive Spawning [THREAD] Benchmark Creation
research.summary: Conducted research within the CSAIL Spoken Language Systems Group (SLS) at MIT for the creation of a benchmark for LLM natural language embedded program generation[cite: 10].
highlights: Produced >50 ground truth Python programs for synthetic data generation to create evaluation dataset[cite: 11].
Created API calls for aggregate data collection and processing from Google Data Commons[cite: 12].

projects.name: ARK (Automated Resource Knowledge Base)
projects.summary: Leading a team of 6 across MIT, GT and UIC to create a community LLM app store and modular personalized agentic assistant development platform[cite: 14].
highlights: Configured LLM Inference with Hugging-Face TGI and Qwen-2.5 weights hosted on HuggingFace Hub[cite: 14].
Created 'base_module interface for agentic tool calling and inference engine abstraction layer[cite: 14].
Organized project outline including "GitHub Org.", task list, weekly meetings, and various repositories for maintaining current and future contribution consistency as project scales[cite: 14].
Secured $5000 grant from MIT SIPB for development server build[cite: 14].
Built and set up headless dev server including installing CUDA kernel, configuring Linux distro, adding user SSH keys, and configuring user permissions[cite: 14, 15].
